sentences.english: The roads and aqueducts of Rome have been the admiration of all after ages.
sentences.chinese: 古罗马的大道和高架渠在其后的年代一直受到羡慕。

sentences.english: There is no cluster to eat, Nor first-ripe fig, which my soul desires.
sentences.chinese: 没有一挂可吃，也没有我魂所羡慕初熟的无花果。

sentences.english: The next play is a merry-go-round, envy television they sat on it.
sentences.chinese: 下一个玩的是旋转木马，好羡慕电视里它们坐在上面。

sentences.english: Every year we gaze enviously at the lists of the richest people in world.
sentences.chinese: 每一年我们羡慕地盯着世界上最有钱的人名单。

sentences.english: In Hanwang, there was a saying that it was enviable to be a worker ofDongfang.
sentences.chinese: 在汉旺，东方汽轮机厂的工人是很令人羡慕的。

sentences.english: All my friends were happy for me and envious.
sentences.chinese: 我所有的朋友都为我感到高兴和羡慕。

sentences.english: He begrudged his friend the award.
Everybody admires him for his fine sense of humour.
sentences.chinese: 人人羡慕他那极好的幽默感。

sentences.english: I knew no one worth envying him.
sentences.chinese: 我知道没有一个人值得我羡慕。

sentences.english: Some with good skills could skate wonderfully. I admired them from the bottom of my heart.
sentences.chinese: 有些人滑得真好，我从心底里羡慕他们。

sentences.english: One might expect that a personal finance blogger would admire the Kirbys.
sentences.chinese: 也许有人会认为，一个金融博客的会羡慕卡比家。

sentences.english: And because of this we are the envy of the rest of the universe.
sentences.chinese: 正因为如此，我们是宇宙其他生命羡慕的对象。

sentences.english: I envy you for giving such a personable and astute son gifted in both cultural and military affairs.
sentences.chinese: 朕羡慕你，有这样识大体明事理，且文武兼备的儿子。

sentences.english: He admired again her grey-black eyebrows, and her lashes.
sentences.chinese: 辛森又一次羡慕起她灰黑的眼眉和睫毛。

sentences.english: The other fish were amazed at his beauty. The called him Rainbow Fish.
sentences.chinese: 别的鱼都羡慕地睁大了眼睛，叫他彩虹鱼。

definition: to admire/to hold in high esteem
to be jealous of (sb's achievements etc)/to be envious/envy
to yearn for/to look forward to
to sigh with sorrow, regret etc/rueful/deeply moved
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
to long for/to look forward to/longing/vision for the future
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to love dearly/to feel sorry for sb/to regret/to grudge/to be distressed
